definition: to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

sentences.english: You know the exact time the vending machines are refilled.
sentences.chinese: 你很清楚饮料贩卖机什么时候会补货。

sentences.english: If the touch early warning line, export pace easily remind sellers adjust replenishment.
sentences.chinese: 倘若触碰预警线，出口易会提醒卖家调整补货步调。

sentences.english: Okay. How long before you have the rest?
sentences.chinese: 好。请问要多久才会补货进来？

sentences.english: It will turn out to two series of signal marginal values if we take fixed cost for replenish in consideration.
sentences.chinese: 若考虑补货的固定启动成本，则解为两组单一临界值。

sentences.english: We haudio-videoe to wait for replenishment. which is expected to get to some two months.
sentences.chinese: 我们必需传世补货，估计两个月才最新。

sentences.english: Flexible in goods replenishment and 100% goods exchange.
sentences.chinese: 公司提供灵活的补货政策，并实行100%调换货。

sentences.english: We haudio-videoe to wait for replenishment; which is expected to get to some two months.
sentences.chinese: 我们必需传世补货，估计两个月才最新。

sentences.english: The offsets for replenishment cycles of multiple products were used to reduce warehouse space and the relevant cost.
sentences.chinese: 通过多产品补货周期的相对偏移节省存贮空间和费用。

definition: to order goods/to place an order
to put together an order of goods
property or cash held in reserve/stock
to place an order/to order/an order (of goods)
to accept delivery of goods/to pick up goods
merchandise or commodities available immediately after sale/merchandise in stock/available item/actuals (investment)/actual commodities
